main event: A civilian reported observing a round, yellowish object, similar in size to a large star, traveling very fast in Euclid, Ohio, on 9th September 1958. The object moved first to the northeast, then to the southeast, and then to the northeast before disappearing out of sight.
interesting points: The description of the object matches the typical maneuvers of an unidentified flying object.
The observer reported that the object was very fast, faster than any jet aircraft they had seen.
The sighting lasted for 2 minutes, and the object covered multiple directions in that time - northeast, southeast, then northeast before disappearing.
The report from a Marine described the object as very fast, reaching a very high altitude, and exhibiting a brilliant white light similar to a distant star.

The handwritten document describes a UFO report in Euclid, Ohio, including details such as observation time, location of the observer, and a mention of conventional activity, possibly indicating other aircraft in the area.
sighted object: Round, yellowish object the size of a large star traveling very fast
witnesses: Civilian, Marine, Mr. and Ms. Dr. in South Euclid, Ohio, and possibly others as mentioned in the handwritten document
